title: Pier Luigi Bersani
snippet: Pier Luigi Bersani (born 29 September 1951) is an Italian politician known for his long career in centre-left politics, including roles as Secretary of the Democratic Party from 7 November 2009 to 20 April 2013 and Minister of Economic Development from 17 May 2006 to 8 May 2008 in the second Prodi government.[1][2][3] Born in Bettola near Piacenza to a family of artisans—his father a mechanic and gas station operator—Bersani graduated in philosophy from the University of Bologna and began his political ascent in the Communist Party, later transitioning through Democratic Left to the Democr

title: Democratic Party (Italy) - Wikipedia
snippet: Former members have included Giorgio Napolitano (President of Italy, 2006–2015), Sergio Mattarella (President of Italy, 2015–present), four Prime Ministers (Romano Prodi, Giuliano Amato, Massimo D'Alema and Renzi), three former leaders (Pier Luigi Bersani, Guglielmo Epifani and, again, Renzi), as well as David Sassoli (President of the European Parliament, 2019–2022), Francesco Rutelli, Pietro Grasso and Carlo Calenda. As of 2025, three regions out of 20 (Emilia-Romagna, Tuscany and Apulia) have Democratic presidents, while in three more regions (Umbria, Campania and Sardinia) the PD is part of the governing coalition.
